newsitem.title: FINLAND: Helsinki bourse, Nokia end up but off record-highs.
newsitem.headline: Helsinki bourse, Nokia end up but off record-highs.

text.p: Finnish shares ended almost one percent higher on the main index in record-high territory on Friday, although below a life-high peak, after telecoms group Nokia had come off its own all-time highs.

Buoyed by a rumour-driven rise in Nokia, the HEX all share index raced to an all-time high 3,123.73 points -- up 24.2 points on the previous record, and a full 25 percent higher than its end-1996 close.
But the HEX eased in late trade and ended 0.9 percent higher at 3,120.08 points.

Nokia peaked at 357.00 markka -- up 9.00 markka or 2.6 percent -- but ran out of steam to close 7.00 markka up at 355.00 markka after denying rumours it was buying its own stock, or that it was buying a Swedish phone equipment maker.
Turnover was a relatively lively 600 million markka with trade in Nokia accounting for over 40 percent.
"Trade could be somewhat calmer on Monday because of the U.S. banking holiday," another trader said. U.S. markets will be closed on Monday.
Forestries eased, with UPM-Kymmene down 0.20 markka at 123.80 and Enso down 0.20 markka at 47.80.
Among banks, Merita staged a late come-back, closing 0.10 markka up at 18.00 markka.
